column4: dual booting is as simple as I presume right? install windows, install ubuntu, grub makes magic. done. eh?
that's how it worked for me :)
make sure you install Windows before Linux. It's much easier that way.
I guessed such, ubuntu tends to be good at working around windows, but not the other way around.
exactly. It's possible to do it the other way around, but you have to mess with GRUB quite a bit.
